lead_paragraph: In a country where the government owns all land, a group of residents in one city will not have to pay a fee to extend the rights to the land under their homes.

headline.print_headline: China Reassures Some Homeowners on Land Rights, Suggesting Trend
headline.main: China Reassures Homeowners Worried About Land Rights

snippet: In a country where the government owns all land, a group of residents in one city will not have to pay a fee to extend the rights to the land under their homes....
abstract: China's vice minister of land and resources Wang Guanghua says Wenzhou, China, homeowners will not have to pay to renew 20-year land leases, countering local officials who told owners they would have to pay large renewal fee; announcement is expected to settle national uncertainty over land-use rights.
